page.title: 02 FARMING - WEST ROW
page.content: THE MAIN INDUSTRY IN WEST ROW IS FARMING. SITUATED ON THE EDGE OF THE FEN MUCH OF THE LAND IS FREE DRAINING WHILST THE REST IS PROTECTED BY A GOOD DRAINAGE SYSTEM. THE MAJORITY OF FARMS ARE ARABLE THOUGH THERE ARE SOME MIXED FARMS WITH CATTLE, PIGS AND SHEEP. AGRICULTURE IN THIS AREA IS BASED ON SUGAR-BEET,POTATOES AND WHEAT.OTHER CROPS INCLUDE BARLEY,RYE,CARROTS,ONIONS AND GRASS.THERE IS A STRICT ROTATION OF CROPS IN ORDER TO LESSEN THE SPREAD OF PESTS AND DISEASE. MARKET GARDENING IS A FEATURE OF THE DISTRICT WITH THE PRODUCE - FLOWERS AND VEGETABLES - BEING SOLD EITHER LOCALLY OR IN LONDON. HIGH WINDS-FEN BLOWS-CAN BE A PROBLEM FOR THE FEN FARMER ESPECIALLY WITH THE NEWLY-SOWN SEED IN SPRING.
